News clipping, " Charles Hanson TownePraises Romance of Cabell" from the Cincinnati Enquirer
Typed biographical sketch of James Branch Cabell
News clipping, "The Artistic Temperament Again" from a signed review by Edwin Markham
Typed extracts from letters re: Cabell by Albert Bigelow Paine, Josephine Prescott Peabodyand a review by H. L. Mencken
Typed note re: "the jackets of Chivalry & the Line of Love..."

Scrapbook containing typescript copies of letters from: Hugh Walpole, Louis Untermeyer, George Sterling, Kate Langley Bosher, Sinclair Lewis, H. L. Mencken, Ernest A. Boyd, Gilbert Cannan, Edward Hale Bierstadt, Joseph Hergesheimer, Wilson Follett, Amelie Rives Troubetzkoy& Pierre Troubetzkoy, Sidney Howard, Paul Jordan Smith, James Hopper, T. R. Smith, William Rose Benetand Ellis P. Oberholtzerto Guy Holtre: the attempted suppression of Jurgen. Also in scrapbook are various newspaper clippings re: James Branch Cabelland Jurgen
Transcripts of legal proceedings in People of the State of New Yorkvs. Guy Holt, Robert M. McBride & Co.& Robert M. McBridein the case against Jurgen
Legal indictment against Guy Holt, Robert M. McBride & Co.& Robert M. McBrideof "unlawfully possessing an indecent book" [ Jurgen]
John S. Summer, Agent for the Suppression of Vice, lists particular pages of Jurgencontaining scenes of lewdness and obscenity
"In Re: A Certain Offensive Lewd Lascivious in Decent Book Called Jurgen" describing passages that have been called offensive
